messages: ba1e7f35f4a7498cb44387faeb8ea7c2 (16:45): heh, I like it -> "If it has a CPU, it can run NetBSD"
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (16:46): s/CPU/mmu/
ba1e7f35f4a7498cb44387faeb8ea7c2 (16:49): right, NetBSD will not run on MMU-less boards
ba1e7f35f4a7498cb44387faeb8ea7c2 (16:54): and we still dont have support for NAND flash chips :/
38b4add4c9e8c1856f3b6279e0df56c8 (17:01): linux can run on mmu-less?
ba1e7f35f4a7498cb44387faeb8ea7c2 (17:01): yes
ba1e7f35f4a7498cb44387faeb8ea7c2 (17:02): maito: http://www.uclinux.org/
38b4add4c9e8c1856f3b6279e0df56c8 (17:02): I once installed (that) linux in my ipod
ba1e7f35f4a7498cb44387faeb8ea7c2 (17:02): and ?
ba1e7f35f4a7498cb44387faeb8ea7c2 (17:03): did it say m00o0 ?
38b4add4c9e8c1856f3b6279e0df56c8 (17:03): so im not sure about ipods mmu
ba1e7f35f4a7498cb44387faeb8ea7c2 (17:03): right
38b4add4c9e8c1856f3b6279e0df56c8 (17:03): it has one but its weird
ba1e7f35f4a7498cb44387faeb8ea7c2 (17:03): i bet they have MMU
ba1e7f35f4a7498cb44387faeb8ea7c2 (17:03): most boards now a days do
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (17:03): Linux hacks around that shit
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (17:04): They don't care if they mutilate the original source beyond recognition
ba1e7f35f4a7498cb44387faeb8ea7c2 (17:04): linux hacks around everything
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (17:04): yeah
b2ffda25cfed2e1adeff06e4fb2f7901 (17:04): They probably even have to hack around their hacks at various spots in the kernel's guts
38b4add4c9e8c1856f3b6279e0df56c8 (17:04): why not :P
ba1e7f35f4a7498cb44387faeb8ea7c2 (17:05): becouse it will create a mess
ba1e7f35f4a7498cb44387faeb8ea7c2 (17:05): and chaos

ba1e7f35f4a7498cb44387faeb8ea7c2 (17:06): on linux
